isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - SPEEDOMETER/TACHOMETER DIAGNOSTICS AND SERVICE - CLUSTER FAILURE DIAGNOSIS - 9800 MODEL

svcsubproc.title: After January 1996

para.title: Speedometer, Odometer, or Tachometer Display Failure

svcsubproc.para: If any of the speedometer, odometer, or tachometer gauge displays is indicating a failure, the circuits serving the instrument in question must be checked for clean, tight, unbroken and non-shorted connections.

important.para: Be sure all relays in the vehicle are the suppressed type.
Make sure the accessory voltage to the cluster is within a range of 11 to 16 volts.

para.title: Speedometer, Odometer, and Tachometer Failure Isolation

svcsubproc.para: The instrument cluster performs a brief self-test when the key switch is turned ON that indicates whether the cluster is functioning properly.

note.para: Operation and accuracy of the speedometer and tachometer can be verified with an EST without removing the cluster. The Pro-Link 9000 with the Instrument Panel Cartridge Kit, or the EZ-Tech with the instrument cluster software can be used to exercise the speedometer/tachometer, through the J1708 data link . Refer to the Pro-Link or EZ-Tech instrument cluster software manual for instructions.

Insure that the vehicle Data Link is not shorted or wired incorrectly. With the igniton on, voltage from Positive data link circuit to ground should be approximately 4 volts. Voltage from Negative data link circuit to ground should be approximately 1 volt. Refer to ELECTRICAL CIRCUIT DIAGRAM MANUAL.

svcsubproc.para: The cluster will test itself each time the vehicle is powered up and indicates by pointer movement, if the cluster is performing properly The pointers should perform as follows:

item.para: The unit will drive both the speedometer and tachometer needles to the 9 o'clock position for about two seconds and return to the "0" position.
Both pointers will then advance through one complete smooth sweep and proceed back to the "0" position. This indicates that all output circuits are good and tells the driver that the gauges are good.

svcsubproc.para: The cluster will provide failure indications in two ways:

item.para: The speedometer and tachometer pointers do not move on power up.
The speedometer and tachometer pointers do not provide a proper gauge sweep or exhibit erratic pointer movement on power up.

svcsubproc.para:
If either of the above failures occurs, the speedo/tach cluster must be removed from the instrument panel and all connections to the vehicle wire harness disconnected for further testing. Refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL
.

Conditions and corrective action are defined in the Speedometer, Odometer, and Tachometer Failure Chart
.

table.title: Speedometer, Odometer, and Tachometer Failure Chart

entry.para: Condition
First Action
Second Action
1. Speedometer and tachometer needles do not move on power up.
Remove cluster and verify ignition voltage and ground is provided to cluster. Refer to ELECTRICAL CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS MANUAL.
Replace cluster.
2. Speedometer or tachometer needle moves erratically or incomplete on power up sweep.

Perform Self Diagnostics Test
.
3. Speedometer pointer is DEAD STILL or does not go through proper sweep when performing the Self Diagnostics Test.
Switch the speedometer and tachometer in the cluster. Rerun test. If the defect follows the meter, replace the meter.
If the defect stays at the same meter location, replace the cluster.
4. Tachometer pointer is DEAD STILL or does not go through proper sweep when performing the Self Diagnostics Test.
Switch the tachometer and speedometer in the cluster. Rerun test. If the defect follows the meter, replace the meter.
If the defect stays at the same meter location, replace the cluster.

5. Odometer does not increment properly as described in Performing the Self Diagnostics Test, Step 2, B
.
Remove odometer from cluster. MOMENTARILY apply 12 volt DC power across odometer leads. If odometer increments with power applied, REPLACE the cluster.
If odometer does not increment, REPLACE the odometer.
6. Speedometer and/or tachometer do not work while driving.
Check speedometer or tachometer sensor wiring continuity and sensor output signal levels. Refer to ELECTRICAL CIRCUIT DIAGRAMS MANUAL.
Go to next step.
7. Speedometer or tachometer do not work or operate inaccurately while driving.

Manually program the cluster by physically setting all DIP switches. Refer to PROGRAMMING
. Check operation. If condition is corrected, leave the DIP switch settings in the new positions.
Replace cluster.

svcsubproc.title: After January 1996 - Performing the Self Diagnostics Test

note.para: Prior to performing the self diagnostics process:

step1.para:
Remove speedo/tach unit from instrument panel and disconnect all connections to vehicle wiring harness. Refer to REMOVE AND INSTALL
.

Write down all DIP switch positions on the speedo/tach unit. The positions will either be a "1" or "0" for each switch. There are two sets of ten switches in each set. Verify the positions are recorded correctly. Switch settings must be set back to the original positions when diagnostics is completed in order for the cluster to work properly.
Set all of the DIP switches to the "0" position.
Attach Cluster Test Harness SE4365 to the speedo/tach unit ( Figure 25).
IMMEDIATELY after inserting the POWER PLUG into the cigar lighter, depress the MOMENTARY SWITCH repeatedly (at least three times) as rapidly as possible (within one second).
If unit is not defective, the speedo/tach unit pointers should:

step2.para: Rotate in unison to the "0" position on the gauge face.
Both pointers will then rotate in unison up-scale in ten equal steps to full scale (85 mph/3500 rpm). The odometer will advance .1 mile for each of the ten steps.
Both pointers will then rotate in unison down-scale back to the "0" position.

step1.para:
If unit fails to perform as described in the Self Diagnostics Test continue on with the Speedometer, Odometer, and Tachometer Failure Chart
.
